result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Matthew Beck

records.addlTxt: Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

9:30 AM Defendant John Matthew Beck not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for John Matthew Beck.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews court record.   Court indicates DEF still has not signed bond.   Attny Chapman no comment.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Minnesota) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Letter mailed to DEF regarding signing bond at SWSO and providing DNA sample.  Copy of letter with bond sent to SWSO
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety.  No drug use and may not possess any controlled substance  without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

11:25AM Defendant John Matthew Beck appeared by video. Attorney Daniel James Chapman not in court for John Matthew Beck. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. OFF THE RECORD 
11:26AM ON THE RECORD - Atty Daniel Chapman is now present.  Court addresses DEF on video appearance.  Atty Chapman makes statement on DEF appearing by video, requests to proceed with INIT.   State does not wish to request warrant due to DEF appearance by video.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties.  Atty Chapman acknowledges receipt of Criminal complaint & waives reading, indicated DEF has not received a copy due to lack of mailing address but information has been presented to DEF.  DEF agrees with Atty Chapman.  Atty Chapman requests prelim, waives time limits.  DEF agrees.  Court finds DEF knowingly and voluntarily waived time limits.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Chapman objects to Justice Point due to location/homelessness of DEF.  Court sets bond.  Court questions DEF on address, DEF responds.  Court orders DEF to appear at Sawyer County Jail to sign bond and provide DNA sample prior to next hearing.  Case is tracking with 21CF233.  Court sets Prelim for 8/2/22 at 3:30PM.  Court indicates DEF must appear in person for next hearing.

COURT:  SIBS $2500  Absolute sobriety.  No drug use and may not possess any controlled substance  without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
